descriptionHtml:
[center][aimg=\'center\']http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/imageshare/images/4097119-1336848646.jpg[/aimg][/center]




[center][color=\'red\'][font=\'Century Gothic\'][size=\'7\']Concept[/size][/font][/color][/center]

[font=\'Century Gothic\']The [size=\'4\'][b]Idea[/b][/size] behind this mod is to make the [size=\'4\'][b]NPC[/b][/size]s in Skyrim look different from each other by using [size=\"4\"][b]Unique bodies[/b][/size] and  [size=\"4\"][b]4 different texture settings[/b][/size], depending on [size=\"4\"][b]Weight[/b][/size], for each playable [size=\"4\"][b]Race[/b][/size] as well as for your [size=\"4\"][b]Character[/b][/size], your characters [size=\"4\"][b]Vampire[/b][/size] form and your characters [size=\"4\"][b]Werewolf[/b][/size] form.

The [size=\"4\"][b]Only[/b][/size]  thing you [size=\"4\"][b]Need[/b][/size] to do is to [size=\"4\"][b]Copy[/b][/size] and [size=\"4\"][b]Paste[/b][/size] files[/font]


BSA file is used as placeholders for the vanilla files so no need to administer over 1000 files. The folder structures that comes with this mod are empty.  You just need to put your own files in the right directory in order for it to work.
The Controller file is named MTC.esm and have only unique objektIDs and the vanilla objektIDs are untouched. Thus the MTC.esm won\'t conflict with other mods.
The different .esp files activates the pointers in the MTC.esm and only uses the SkinNaked and SkinNakedBeast ObjektIDs or the Actor Player ObjektID. Thus the .esp files will only conflict with mods that uses these ObjektIDs. 
Empty folder structures comes with the different .esp files so you dont need to have a full folder structure if you don\'t want to.
author: Basvanbeu
